condition.description:
Malaria is a serious disease caused by a parasite. You get it when an infected mosquito bites you. Malaria is a major cause of death worldwide, but it is almost wiped out in the United States. The disease is mostly a problem in developing countries with warm climates. If you travel to these countries, you are at risk. There are four different types of malaria caused by four related parasites. The most deadly type occurs in Africa south of the Sahara Desert.

Malaria symptoms include chills, flu-like symptoms, fever, vomiting, diarrhea, and jaundice. A blood test can diagnose it. It can be life-threatening. However, you can treat malaria with drugs. The type of drug depends on which kind of malaria you have and where you were infected.

Malaria can be prevented. When traveling to malaria-prone regions

  • See your doctor for medicines that protect you
  • Wear insect repellent with DEET
  • Cover up
  • Sleep under mosquito netting

Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
condition.name: Malaria
symptoms: Jaundice: Yellowing of skin and eyes, dark-colored urine, pale stools

userStories.tip: Taking it after lunch, with food and water seems to reduce side effects

labeled_indications.indication: Plasmodium falciparum or P vivax Malaria

carousel_items: Don’t give up on Plaquenil, it can take 2-4 months to take effect.
Take Plaquenil with milk to help decrease nausea.
If you have difficulty swallowing Plaquenil, you can crush it, and mix it in jam or jelly.

While taking Plaquenil it is important to wear sunglasses in bright light to protect your eyes from damage. When you can’t avoid sunlight, be sure to use sunscreen, put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, and a hat.
Stay away from alcohol while taking Plaquenil.
Certain medications can interact with Plaquenil, so to be safe, tell your doctor about other medications and supplements you may be taking.

basics.benefits_moa: Plaquenil is called a DMARD, a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug. It prevents your body from activating cells that cause inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Plaquenil is a great medication for rheumatoid arthritis and comes with less side effects than other DMARDs.
downsides: You will likely have to take additional medications like Methotrexate to keep your RA in control.
In some people, small particles develop in the eyes, so you’ll have to get your eyes checked once per year.
It can take up to 6 months before the full benefits of Plaquenil are felt.
Many people have nausea, stomach cramps, and diarrhea when they first start taking Plaquenil.

downsides_processed.orig: You will likely have to take additional medications like Methotrexate to keep your RA in control.
In some people, small particles develop in the eyes, so you’ll have to get your eyes checked once per year.
It can take up to 6 months before the full benefits of Plaquenil are felt.
Many people have nausea, stomach cramps, and diarrhea when they first start taking Plaquenil.

upsides: Plaquenil has been shown to improve physical function in up to 80% of patients.
Plaquenil and similar DMARD medications help minimize joint damage, decrease symptoms and lessen future complications.
Plaquenil is an excellent choice for people who have difficulty tolerating newer biologic medications.
A generic form of Plaquenil is available.

upsides_processed.orig: Plaquenil has been shown to improve physical function in up to 80% of patients.
Plaquenil and similar DMARD medications help minimize joint damage, decrease symptoms and lessen future complications.
Plaquenil is an excellent choice for people who have difficulty tolerating newer biologic medications.
A generic form of Plaquenil is available.

drugs.one_liner: Improves inflammatory conditions like rheumatoid arthritis.

userStories.tip: Eye checkups important....important to stay on daily regimen if for lupus
Take Plaquenil not Quinoric
get regular checkups with eye doctor, get regular bloodwork
Take after food. Get regular eye tests.Has stabilized my lupus and antibody levels have gone down.

drugs.name: Plaquenil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don’t give up on Plaquenil, it can take 2-4 months to take effect.
Take Plaquenil with milk to help decrease nausea.
If you have difficulty swallowing Plaquenil, you can crush it, and mix it in jam or jelly.

While taking Plaquenil it is important to wear sunglasses in bright light to protect your eyes from damage. When you can’t avoid sunlight, be sure to use sunscreen, put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, and a hat.
Stay away from alcohol while taking Plaquenil.
Certain medications can interact with Plaquenil, so to be safe, tell your doctor about other medications and supplements you may be taking.

risks_warnings.title: Prescribing Information
risks_warnings.description: Doctors should be completely familiar with the medication label before prescribing Plaquenil.

description_processed.orig: Doctors should be completely familiar with the medication label before prescribing Plaquenil.

risks_warnings.title: Drug resistance
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil is not effective against chloroquine-resistant strains of P. falciparum malaria.

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil is not effective against chloroquine-resistant strains of P. falciparum malaria.

risks_warnings.title: Children
risks_warnings.description: Children are especially sensitive to medications like Plaquenil, which contain 4-aminoquinoline. Ingestion of small amounts has caused death in children. So to be safe, keep Plaquenil out of the reach of children.

description_processed.orig: Children are especially sensitive to medications like Plaquenil, which contain 4-aminoquinoline. Ingestion of small amounts has caused death in children. So to be safe, keep Plaquenil out of the reach of children.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil should only be used in pregnancy for malaria when using it outweighs its harmful effects. The IV form of Plaquenil has been shown to cross the placenta rapidly and can harm the baby.

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil should only be used in pregnancy for malaria when using it outweighs its harmful effects. The IV form of Plaquenil has been shown to cross the placenta rapidly and can harm the baby.

risks_warnings.title: Damage to retina of eye
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil can cause blurred vision, difficulty reading, and damage to the retina of the eye during or after long-term treatment. The chance of this happening is less with lower doses. Before starting treatment, your doctor may send you to an ophthalmologist (eye doctor) to carefully examine both eyes. This should be repeated at least once a year. If you have trouble seeing color or clearly, call your doctor and stop taking Plaquenil. These effects may last even after stopping the medicine.
risk_factors: Taking Plaquenil in higher than recommended doses

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil can cause blurred vision, difficulty reading, and damage to the retina of the eye during or after long-term treatment. The chance of this happening is less with lower doses. Before starting treatment, your doctor may send you to an ophthalmologist (eye doctor) to carefully examine both eyes. This should be repeated at least once a year. If you have trouble seeing color or clearly, call your doctor and stop taking Plaquenil. These effects may last even after stopping the medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

off-label_indications.indication: HIV infection - Pneumocystis pneumonia Malaria; Prophylaxis

userStories.tip: US price is ridiculous. Buy it from reputable Canadian Pharmacies by mail.

carousel_items: Drink plenty of water while taking this medication.
Take with food or milk to prevent an upset stomach.
It takes at least 2 to 6 weeks to experience the full benefit of this medication.
Your doctor can run blood tests to make sure the medication is working as it should.

clock.tip: Take after meals and drink plenty of water.

basics.benefits_moa: Allopurinol is a type of medicine called a xanthine oxidase inhibitor. It lowers uric acid levels in your blood, which prevents gout attacks and certain types of kidney stones.
basics.bottom_line: Allopurinol works well to prevent gout attacks and is cheaper than some alternatives, but it takes a few weeks to kick in.
downsides: Can actually increase the number of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
It can take 2 to 6 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
You should drink a lot of fluids to prevent kidney stones from forming while taking this medication.

downsides_processed.orig: Can actually increase the number of gout attacks in the first few weeks.
It can take 2 to 6 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
You should drink a lot of fluids to prevent kidney stones from forming while taking this medication.

upsides: Works well to lower the amount of uric acid in the body to reduce gout attacks.
Available as a generic medication.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to lower the amount of uric acid in the body to reduce gout attacks.
Available as a generic medication.

userStories.tip: I was taking Allopurinol from 2000. I underwent for an operation in the big toe and subsequently in Elbow joint due to Gout problem.

userStories.identifier: 51 years old slightly obese not fit
userStories.tip: I used to use it long term for gout prevention but essentially after a year i weaned off. Now if i get an inkling of an attack, I take about 1000mg and it works to stop the attack. I know that's not the indicated way, but
I couldn't exist without it.

I'm on just about the lowest dose available (100mg 2x daily) and my uric acid is very well controlled, plus I don't have to been too fussy with my diet (e.g., I can consume mushrooms, spinach, etc., and other relatively high purine foods).

drugs.name: Allopurinol

off-label_indications.indication: High uric acid from taking a thiazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Drink plenty of water while taking this medication.
Take with food or milk to prevent an upset stomach.
It takes at least 2 to 6 weeks to experience the full benefit of this medication.
Your doctor can run blood tests to make sure the medication is working as it should.

risks_warnings.title: Increased gout attacks
risks_warnings.description: People who first start Allopurinol can experience increased gout attacks as they take the medication for the first few weeks. This is common. Your doctor can prescribe other medications to prevent these attacks from occurring.

description_processed.orig: People who first start Allopurinol can experience increased gout attacks as they take the medication for the first few weeks. This is common. Your doctor can prescribe other medications to prevent these attacks from occurring.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: People who take Allopurinol can be more likely to have kidney stones, especially if you're dehydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 eight ounce glasses of water every day to help prevent that from happening.

description_processed.orig: People who take Allopurinol can be more likely to have kidney stones, especially if you're dehydrated. Drink at least 10 to 12 eight ounce glasses of water every day to help prevent that from happening.

risks_warnings.title: Skin rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Allopurinol who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people taking Allopurinol who get a severe skin rash that can require hospitalization or can cause death. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with fever.

risks_warnings.title: Liver disease
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Allopurinol who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Allopurinol who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
If you're using birth control pills, this medication can make them less effective.
Wear sunblock if you have to go out into the sun since your skin can become more sensitive to sunburn.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any vitamins by at least two hours.
Take with plenty of food and liquids.
Don't take any medications with bismuth (Pepto-Bismol, Kaopectate) while taking this medication.
Don't lie down for at least 30 minutes after taking this medication.

clock.tip: Drink a lot of water to prevent stomach irritation and ulcers.

basics.benefits_moa: Doxycycline is a tetracycline antibiotic. It stops bacteria by preventing them from reproducing and repairing themselves.
basics.bottom_line: Doxycycline is good for treating many bacterial infections. It is also available as generic. However, it can make birth control pills less effective. You also have to protect yourself against sunburn.
downsides: Can't be used in pregnant women and children under 8 years old.
Makes your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Has to be taken with plenty of water and food and you have to stay upright for 30 minutes afterwards to avoid stomach irritation.
Can make birth control less effective.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used in pregnant women and children under 8 years old.
Makes your skin more sensitive to the sun.
Has to be taken with plenty of water and food and you have to stay upright for 30 minutes afterwards to avoid stomach irritation.
Can make birth control less effective.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in generic.
Available in different forms: tablet, capsule, and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.
Less resistance seen in bacteria to this antibiotic. Your doctor may run tests to see which antibiotics will kill the bacteria causing your infection.

userStories.identifier: Kayaker, bicycle love to be outdoors
userStories.tip: Take a good probiotic, cleared up my Rosacea and hives in two weeks and use sunscreen, hat always
It was very expensive and made me extremely nauseous.
I've been taking it for a few months, but I've actually had more cystic acne than usual.  I don't know if it's from an uptick in stress or if the medication isn't working, so use at your own caution.

Felt better on it after a herxheimer reaction.  Finished 3 week course and lyme relapsed.  Doesn't treat the cystic form of lyme so it can come back once you stop.  Makes you sunburn easily.  Take probiotics such as kefir or greek yogurt.
Take the full course, even if you have side effects because the infection won't go away.

drugs.name: Doxycycline

off-label_indications.indication: STI prevention for victims of sexual assault

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take the medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
If you're using birth control pills, this medication can make them less effective.
Wear sunblock if you have to go out into the sun since your skin can become more sensitive to sunburn.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.
Space out any vitamins by at least two hours.
Take with plenty of food and liquids.
Don't take any medications with bismuth (Pepto-Bismol, Kaopectate) while taking this medication.
Don't lie down for at least 30 minutes after taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in teeth
risks_warnings.description: This medication can cause changes in the color and development of teeth in fetuses and in children younger than 8 years old. Your doctor will recommend alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: This medication can cause changes in the color and development of teeth in fetuses and in children younger than 8 years old. Your doctor will recommend alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased effectiveness of birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Doxycycline and you're also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Doxycycline.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Doxycycline and you're also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Doxycycline.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea from a superinfection (an infection that happens after, or in addition to, an earlier infection)
risks_warnings.description: Taking antibiotics, like Doxycycline can increase your chance of getting certain fungal or bacterial infections that causes diarrhea and can be contagious. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor since this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: Taking antibiotics, like Doxycycline can increase your chance of getting certain fungal or bacterial infections that causes diarrhea and can be contagious. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor since this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Rash
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of severe skin rashes that can require hospitalization or can serious injury. These have been rare, but talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with a fever.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of severe skin rashes that can require hospitalization or can serious injury. These have been rare, but talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly develop a severe blistering skin rash with a fever.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Doxycycline and have to be out in the sun for an extended amount of time, put on sunblock on the exposed areas of skin. Your skin can be more sensitive to the sun and is at higher risk for sunburn.

description_processed.orig: If you're taking Doxycycline and have to be out in the sun for an extended amount of time, put on sunblock on the exposed areas of skin. Your skin can be more sensitive to the sun and is at higher risk for sunburn.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Doxycycline may cause birth defects. Don't use Doxycycline while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Doxycycline may cause birth defects. Don't use Doxycycline while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: High intracranial blood pressure and stroke
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of increased blood pressure in the head. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly get a severe headache or changes in your vision.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of increased blood pressure in the head. These have been rare. Talk to your doctor immediately if you suddenly get a severe headache or changes in your vision.

points.name: Upper abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

points.name: Vaginal yeast infection
points.hlt: vaginal and vulval infections and inflammations

carousel_items: Inspect all household members for lice and eggs (nits) with a magnifying glass in bright light. Use a comb to lift and part the hair. Unlike dandruff, nits stick to hair.
Don't use a shampoo that contains a conditioner or use a conditioner alone since it interacts with Permethrin.
Begin to apply Permethrin behind the ears and at the back of the neck. Leave it in for only 10 minutes and then rinse with warm water. Protect your eyes with a washcloth or towel.
If live lice are seen 7 days or more after the first treatment, then a second treatment should be given.

basics.benefits_moa: Permethrin is a topical pediculicide and ovicide treatment that destroys little bugs and their eggs.
basics.bottom_line: Permethrin works great, but make sure to read the directions carefully before using it.
downsides: Can't be used on children under 2 months of age.
Can't be used near the eyes, nose, vagina, or on eyebrows or eyelashes.
Scalp itching or redness can occur.
You can't use it if you're allergic to ragweed since it can cause difficulty breathing or an asthma attack.
Can't use conditioner for a week after using Permethrin.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used on children under 2 months of age.
Can't be used near the eyes, nose, vagina, or on eyebrows or eyelashes.
Scalp itching or redness can occur.
You can't use it if you're allergic to ragweed since it can cause difficulty breathing or an asthma attack.
Can't use conditioner for a week after using Permethrin.

upsides: Permethrin comes with a kit that contains a metal lice comb, disposable gloves, and a salon cape.
A single application is usually sufficient to get rid of head lice.
Permethrin stays in the hair for 10 days, even after showering with a conditioner-free shampoo.
Permethrin is designed to leave the hair easy to comb after using.

upsides_processed.orig: Permethrin comes with a kit that contains a metal lice comb, disposable gloves, and a salon cape.
A single application is usually sufficient to get rid of head lice.
Permethrin stays in the hair for 10 days, even after showering with a conditioner-free shampoo.
Permethrin is designed to leave the hair easy to comb after using.

drugs.name: Nix

If live lice are seen 7 days or more after the first treatment, then a second treatment should be given.

risks_warnings.title: Itching
risks_warnings.description: Permethrin can cause head itching. This is usually a consequence of the head lice infestation itself, but can be temporarily worsened following treatment with Permethrin. Other reactions which are less frequent include: stinging/burning, tingling, numbness or discomfort, redness, and swelling or rash of the scalp. All these reactions are mild and temporary.

description_processed.orig: Permethrin can cause head itching. This is usually a consequence of the head lice infestation itself, but can be temporarily worsened following treatment with Permethrin. Other reactions which are less frequent include: stinging/burning, tingling, numbness or discomfort, redness, and swelling or rash of the scalp. All these reactions are mild and temporary.

points.name: Mild and temporary burning and stinging

Many people have nausea, stomach cramps, and diarrhea when they first start taking Plaquenil.

upsides: Plaquenil has been shown to improve physical function in up to 80% of patients.
Plaquenil and similar DMARD medications help minimize joint damage, decrease symptoms and lessen future complications.
Plaquenil is an excellent choice for people who have difficulty tolerating newer biologic medications.
A generic form of Plaquenil is available.

upsides_processed.orig: Plaquenil has been shown to improve physical function in up to 80% of patients.
Plaquenil and similar DMARD medications help minimize joint damage, decrease symptoms and lessen future complications.
Plaquenil is an excellent choice for people who have difficulty tolerating newer biologic medications.
A generic form of Plaquenil is available.

drugs.one_liner: Improves inflammatory conditions like rheumatoid arthritis.

userStories.tip: Eye checkups important....important to stay on daily regimen if for lupus
Take Plaquenil not Quinoric
get regular checkups with eye doctor, get regular bloodwork
Take after food. Get regular eye tests.Has stabilized my lupus and antibody levels have gone down.

drugs.name: Plaquenil

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don’t give up on Plaquenil, it can take 2-4 months to take effect.
Take Plaquenil with milk to help decrease nausea.
If you have difficulty swallowing Plaquenil, you can crush it, and mix it in jam or jelly.

While taking Plaquenil it is important to wear sunglasses in bright light to protect your eyes from damage. When you can’t avoid sunlight, be sure to use sunscreen, put on a long-sleeved shirt, pants, and a hat.
Stay away from alcohol while taking Plaquenil.
Certain medications can interact with Plaquenil, so to be safe, tell your doctor about other medications and supplements you may be taking.

risks_warnings.title: Prescribing Information
risks_warnings.description: Doctors should be completely familiar with the medication label before prescribing Plaquenil.

description_processed.orig: Doctors should be completely familiar with the medication label before prescribing Plaquenil.

risks_warnings.title: Drug resistance
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil is not effective against chloroquine-resistant strains of P. falciparum malaria.

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil is not effective against chloroquine-resistant strains of P. falciparum malaria.

risks_warnings.title: Children
risks_warnings.description: Children are especially sensitive to medications like Plaquenil, which contain 4-aminoquinoline. Ingestion of small amounts has caused death in children. So to be safe, keep Plaquenil out of the reach of children.

description_processed.orig: Children are especially sensitive to medications like Plaquenil, which contain 4-aminoquinoline. Ingestion of small amounts has caused death in children. So to be safe, keep Plaquenil out of the reach of children.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil should only be used in pregnancy for malaria when using it outweighs its harmful effects. The IV form of Plaquenil has been shown to cross the placenta rapidly and can harm the baby.

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil should only be used in pregnancy for malaria when using it outweighs its harmful effects. The IV form of Plaquenil has been shown to cross the placenta rapidly and can harm the baby.

risks_warnings.title: Damage to retina of eye
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil can cause blurred vision, difficulty reading, and damage to the retina of the eye during or after long-term treatment. The chance of this happening is less with lower doses. Before starting treatment, your doctor may send you to an ophthalmologist (eye doctor) to carefully examine both eyes. This should be repeated at least once a year. If you have trouble seeing color or clearly, call your doctor and stop taking Plaquenil. These effects may last even after stopping the medicine.
risk_factors: Taking Plaquenil in higher than recommended doses

description_processed.orig: Plaquenil can cause blurred vision, difficulty reading, and damage to the retina of the eye during or after long-term treatment. The chance of this happening is less with lower doses. Before starting treatment, your doctor may send you to an ophthalmologist (eye doctor) to carefully examine both eyes. This should be repeated at least once a year. If you have trouble seeing color or clearly, call your doctor and stop taking Plaquenil. These effects may last even after stopping the medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Plaquenil lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert
